reviews.text: Second time making it out here. They have the best Venezuelan arapas. I got the one with shredded chicken and fried plantains. The sauces are so good and the masa is light and fluffy with a crisp outside.

I had the pulled pork arepas and it was so amazing. the portions look small but they‚Äôre very filling, almost couldn‚Äôt finish it. I told the staff about my gluten allergy (celiac) and they gave me details on what i could and couldn‚Äôt have. Very kind staff with awareness. Very nice spacious eating area.

White Maize has been on my list for a long time, so once I had a reason to be in Carroll Gardens, I decided to finally check it out! I walked in around 3:30pm on a Thursday, and I was the sole customer. They have a small (~ 6 small parties) seating area and restrooms for those who want to dine in, and whoever was in control of the music was a Swiftie! I will say that both times I have been here the person working the register has not been the most alert, but apologetic once I got their attention.

I got the pulled pork bowl ($15.16), which is an elevated Chipotle bowl. I went for the bowl over the arepas because 1 arepa was almost the same price, and I felt like the bowl would be more filling. If you prefer smaller meals, I think you can get the most bang for your buck with the bowl, since you can split it into 2 meals. I was starving, so I consumed it all in one sitting, and it was filling indeed! I felt like the ingredient selection and quality justified the price, and the plantains were definitely a highlight! The pulled pork was juicy and well flavored, rice was on the softer side, and the tomatoes in the salsa (under avocado in picture) were delicious. My only critique of this bowl is that the layout is pretty but not practical for mixing.

Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way for White Maize but I will be a regular when I have business in the area!

I always wanna try arepas since I never had this dish until I started traveling. Although I can only speak as a foreigner not familiar with this dish, I think it was delicious.
A chill, low-key place to enjoy food with friends. Staff was also friendly.

I had the Pabellon arepas. Although the pulled beef was slightly dry, everything else was delicious. The corn pancake was slightly crispy outside.

‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®My VIP goes to their Tres Leches cake..!! It was rich, moist, and creamy.

But I don‚Äôt recommend their flan, have to be honest. It was hard like jello. Not the expected texture.
Absolutely amazing!!!! The arepa with shredded beef, platanos, black beans with rice and cheese and tostones with shrimp are simply amazing. Love this spot!

editorial_summary.overview: Traditional Venezuelan eats doled out in a compact space with communal tables & rustic-cool touches.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.8/5 rating across 5 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the delicious and unique Venezuelan arepas, highlighting the light and fluffy masa with a crisp outside and flavorful fillings like shredded chicken and fried plantains. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The restaurant is praised for its accommodating and kind staff, who are attentive to dietary restrictions such as gluten allergies, ensuring a welcoming dining experience. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
The spacious and chill ambiance of the dining area, combined with enjoyable music, creates a relaxed environment perfect for social gatherings. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
